author: fanna
title: BORA: Empower Tomorrow’s Leaders
description: Thousands of students are excluded from education because they cannot access student loans (funding) due to a lack of a credit record and/or lack of access to funding.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal aims to create a DAO based project on Cardano, BORA DAO based on the principle of Project Catalyst underlying principle of Voltaire Governance Protocols and full decentralisation mechanism. This idea intends to mainly focus on funding of student loan globally with a case study in Uganda, from students from a University as first cohort and community members in the project. The creation and development of such a DAO based project in Cardano will be a testament that the Blockchain is in fact ready and enabling environment for intending and potential project see Cardano as a place to build their DAOs and also a reference point. The proposal should be supported as it definitely addresses criteria of the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has a sufficient and well articulated plans and step by step process to achieve the different stages of its project development. The budget estimates which resonates with its detailed roadmaps are quite elaborate and reasonable. The profile of the proponents shows that they have the required qualifications and knowledge although not much can be said about their experiences and past achievements within the space. Their intended collaborations within the community to mitigate their shortcomings, I believe that the proposal is definitely in good hands for an effective implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has provided sufficient information on how the project should be monitor and assessed. The success metrics which are tied to it's budget, milestones are quite verifiable, elaborate and reasonable. Am convinced that the community has necessary information to significantly assess and confirm the progress and development of the proposal if eventually funded.

f6_assessments.q0: The description of the solution is extremely (in a positive way) detailed, and it helps the reader to understand exactly the plan and how it generates impact. The BORA project built on top of Cardano contributes both to the challenge goals of developing DAOs’ solutions and promotes access to education using blockchain technologies. Moreover, the proposal is scalable through its tokenomics system that is described in the solution. One can understand BORA and a sort of Fintech focusing on education and having blockchain solutions for its decentralized governance and execution, which is quite a creative design. For all these reasons, I firmly believe it has impact.
f6_assessments.q1: By having considered a broad set of risks that could challenge the proposal implementation, by having presented the references of the 5 members responsible for this proposal and their respective skills, and by having a well-described roadmap, I believe that this proposal is feasible. There’s only one point that raised my attention in this assessment, which is the fact that the proposal says that they are requesting the budget for the engineer's salaries only. Therefore, “operating, marketing and general expenses will be funded from another source”. This does need to be a problem, but proposers could have explained what are these other sources (is it the other funded and related proposal?) and/or if the project could fail if the other sources fail in providing the complimentary budget. As this is not a major issue, but rather a question of being even more transparent, I applied no penalties to this aspect.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is auditable via different means, starting from the public repository available on github. Important to mention that proposers have indicated a sufficient number of metrics (all related to the proposal’s execution) and explained how they will be measured, which is something rare in many proposals. The view of success is realistic and presents the execution of all the milestones. In addition, they present a modest, but fair number of funded proposals once BORA is running after 36 weeks. For all this excellent design, a score of 5 is more than deserved.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you for the excellent​ review and feedback, we appreciate your work. We are looking forward to our project and we believe we can have a positive impact for students on Cardano.

f6_assessments.q0:
The stated problem is lack of access to education because of lack of funding. The proposal seeks to address this lack through loans to students. This approach is not clear in how it addresses the challenge of creating more tools for DAOs. 

The proposal goes on to explain that a DAO will be used to manage the funds and make decisions about funding. 

The proposal goes on to describe tools to be built in order to run the DAO. With this information it it unclear if the goal of the proposal is to assist in making DAOs accessible to others or if the goal is to make a DAO for this project.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has some members with experience relevant to the technical aspects of building tools on Cardano. The team has a Plutus Pioneer, a web developer. An economist is also listed. 

It is not clear that the proposers have much experience with the problem they are seeking to solve. The connection to the community could be explained better.

The difficulty in assessing the likely success here is that the proposers have experiences that could be useful in this challenge, but the track records cited do not show relevant experience or success with actual related projects.
f6_assessments.q2:
The feasibility section is well documented and detailed with objective criteria. 

The timeline is easy to follow. Milestones and goals are very clear. 

The numbers and timeline are very ambitious, but the question is, do we have adequate information to audit the proposal. The answer is yes, the team is very transparent about how they measure success, and the road to success.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal tries to create BORA, a DAO for applying and giving student loans in project catalyst style. The DAO mechanism is explained very clearly, where the lender is incentivized to deposit their stable coin into the treasury by getting ~6% APY, and then will receive vBORA token which is used for governance on the BORA protocol. The proposal is well written with a thorough plan. Considering the inexpensive requested budget and the potential impact of the project, I personally hope the project can get through. The proposal provide numerous risks that may face the project. However, the proposal include a mitigation plans to overcome all those risks.
f6_assessments.q1: The milestones are explained not only in the points but also described very clearly, also with a very specific roadmap. The budget used is broken down into great detail, up to cost per hour, which is pretty inexpensive. The proposal provides very detailed information on each core team's background, experience, and relevant skills. However, there is only one link to Bradley's (the proposers) Github account, it can be better if all of the members provide LinkedIn/other portfolio links so the community can verify their credibility.
f6_assessments.q2: There are 5 points used to measure the project progress, from the number and size of Github commits to matching expenditure as stated in the proposal. The monthly report for catalyst and the open GitHub repo made the community very easy to track the project progress. The defined success of the project is very clear and quantifiable, where each point is divided into 12 weeks, 24 weeks, and 36 weeks.
f6_assessments.reply: We appreciate your review and thank you for the feedback. We are looking forward to implementing our solution.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal aims to address the problem of students being excluded from education for not getting a student loan due to a lack of credit record and/or lack of access to funding by democratizing student loans with BORA DAO. This DAO will be administered by the community to approve student loans. This proposal already aims to offer a student loan at an APY of 8 percent. This project will provide significant added value to the cardano ecosystem for students around the world in need of a student loan. The proposal is watertight. This project is directly linked to the requested challenges. The creator of this proposal has linked these needs and provided a detailed explanation of how this will happen. Future challenges are included in the proposal along with how they have been addressed. The proposal has a clear explanation of how it will tackle the given problem statement.
f6_assessments.q1: The people who will contribute to this proposal are included herein. The relevant experiences of these people can be found on github. The team consists of people needed to fully develop this project. The budget is very clearly defined. The funding will be to pay the technicians. The other costs will be financed through another source. The makers of the proposal have ensured that you can see very clearly what will happen (every two weeks). The budget will certainly be sufficient to achieve the objectives. There will be a return for funding to develop Bora DAO v2.0. A timetable has been offered to work out the project. It might be better to allow more time for some milestones. An implementation plan is included in the proposal. Samples will be conducted on the Mainnet. The technical aspects are included in the proposal and are clearly defined. The risks and challenges are included in the proposal. It is good that for these problems there is a clear solution to solve them. An extensive campaign will also be very important to make this a success.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a very extensive road map with the associated milestones. This roadmap is very extensive and detailed. The makers offer a lot of transparency about what needs to be done and within what time frame this will happen. Very good KPIs have been included to measure the success of this project. It is good that the milestones are directly linked to the planned deadline that are included. It is good that the makers have chosen to set up KPIs to measure success in the short and long term. (12, 24 and 36 weeks). The proposal clearly describes the intended problem (study loans). This project offers a clear solution for delivering student loans by working with BORA.

f6_assessments.q0: There is no society in the world that can improve without education, hence to develop an idea where it empowers students to by providing the loan is definitely a great idea. The idea of building a portal where students can get loan in transparent manner will also help in showing the people about clean governance, This will also help cardano eco system with proper reputation, where it can show how cardano eco system is helping society to make a society a better place to live , with clear goal ahead this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.

Excluding the above point building a web portal which is interactive and most transparent can be achieved , since the team has experienced people consisting of Plutus and Web developers , and members who have worked for marketing in past for more than 20 years, hence with given experience and plan presented it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The audit has presented the proposed solution in best possible manner where it includes steps in building in portal ,Efficiency of Bora coins for future aspects  and challenges that the team might face, the plan has presented more than 5-6 challenges  in detailed manner which shows the team has worked on pre planning more efficiently.
The audit has introduced the team members and their expertise field with their contribution in block chain development , the presented idea has excellent timeline fixed to complete the project and have proper estimated budgeting to make the project still more efficient . Hence ,the information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you for the excellent feed back and generous review. We are looking forward to changing the world through education.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal wanted to create a DAO platform assisting student for applying and having loans in project catalyst style of funding. The proposed DAO mechanism has been explained very clearly, where it also mentions on how the monetization, incentive and deposit system, and token & governance that will be happening on BORA protocol. The proposal has also considered various risk that might happen during its development, yet each of them has been mitigated quite well in the proposal. Considering on low-cost requested on the proposal yet with a very thorough plan, the proposal will give a great long term impact with its great features, so I personally wish this proposal could be approved.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has provided a very concise and detailed roadmap and timeline, each detailed action on basis of week. The requested budget has also broken down very very detailed up to the cost per hour specific in every week. Each core team's member background and relevant experience has also been provided. Measuring the provided details in the proposal, including the personal skills of the PIC’s, it should be safe to say that the proposal is completely feasible. However, only 1 person in the PIC’s attached with his Linkedin profile, as I would suggest that it should be better to attach the others too to make the information of each of them more convincing and prove-able.
f6_assessments.q2: There proposal mentioned 5 key points to measure the progress. Those points revolves around the quantifiable number and size of Github commits to matching expenditure as stated in the proposal. The proposal also mentioned that they would update on monthly report for catalyst and they would also have a open GitHub repository for the community, making it is completely auditable. The finish line of success mentioned in the proposal is also very clear.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you for the great review and feedback. We appreciate your work. We are looking froward to change the world with education.

f6_assessments.q0:
Project Catalyst is a great place to get together with people from everywhere on Earth, learn and support each other. Implementing this idea to student loans is simply a fantastic idea. There are some countries that put a heavy burden on students with loans, or some countries with a limited opportunities to students. I like to think this project as scholarship actually, since they are trying to make the repayments with minimum burden on loaners; like pushing the payback process until their graduation.

They are planning to use Voltaire governance protocol to operate as DAO, which is saying they are planning to make a self-sustaining project. They mention that self-sustainability will be their end  goal. Their token holders and contributors will have a voice on how the project will execute its projects. One of the hard parts for this is finding trustworthy users at first. Almost all DAOs have this risk; users with bad intentions trying to rig the new systems. Project is also giving their contributors right to bring more people that they trust. This vouching process is a solid plan.

An intricate project like this comes with many risks to be honest. For example, they always need to keep their liquidity pool full. It is very easy to end up like Terra project if this is not done. When you read the project, you can safely say that team is aware of the risks and they have planned their mitigation from the get go. It is great to see the project has started working in Uganda. The team has already started helping people. This proposal could be one of the perfect answers to this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The planning is solid, they have addressed their key milestones and laid them out to reasonable timeline. They are planning to release two minimum products before the end product. They identified each of these product versions clearly. It can be seen very easily that they know what they are doing. After seeing such a workload and planning everyone would wait a high budget. However, they are already funded for some part of the project and they kept the pricing for their engineers in a very reasonable price. Actually $44,000 budget is more than reasonable. This can be said easily especially after looking at the people who will be working on the project. Not many projects can say that they have a teammate that has MBA from Stanford. Every single person is a perfect choice for the project.
f6_assessments.q2:
As I have mentioned in the previous section, they have laid out their milestones very clearly. To keep track of this they have divided these steps as a percentage, and any time they want to check their progress they can easily say the percentage; with that everyone can be on the same page instantly, For the progress, they have also mentioned the staying on time and not burning down your budget quickly. Both of which are generally overshadowed by other metrics in other projects but this team knows that these are as important as the milestones. One question I have about that is they want to prepare monthly progress reports for Catalyst. They might want to present these reports to their community as well. 

Lastly, they have identified three different success metrics with three different times. Separating the project success to parts is better than just giving one final goal.
f6_assessments.reply: We appreciate the detailed feedback and generous review, thank you. We are looking forward to implement our solution and to have a real world positive impact for students. We are excited about all the support from the Catalyst community.

f6_assessments.q0: Many students are excluded from education because they cannot access student loans: lack of credit records and/or lack of access to funding. The author came up with the idea of Democratizing access to student loans with the BORA DAO, a community-run and managed DAO. Good proposal and impact to challenge. Bora will bring financial inclusion, accessibility and sustainability to students around the world. The proposal describes in detail and is rich, creating conditions and opportunities for students to easily access and use financial resources to study. The proposal has given specific solutions, and explained in detail and dense. Besides, the author has given many challenges in the project. At the same time, along with those challenges, the author has all solutions to minimize risks when the project is implemented. That shows that the ability and preparation of the proponent is very active.
f6_assessments.q1: The author has provided a very detailed plan. We have enough information to rate this section. The first is the route. According to what is provided, we are told the project roadmap will be implemented in 24 weeks. Simultaneously there are 3 versions: Version 0.1 Packaging and minimal product functionality; Version 0.2 Minimum Viable Product; Version 1.0 Product launch. The to-dos are detailed in the weeks. Next is the budget. The proposal requires a budget of $44,000. This is a reasonable asking value. As the author said budget is needed to fund the engineers. Operating, marketing and general expenses will be financed from another source. At the same time, the author also provides a detailed budget table, analyzed for each job by time ratio in a coherent way. Budget transparency, increase reliability and sustainability for the project. Finally, about the team of team members. We know the members are all people with the right skills and experience to do the work on the project. At the same time, the author also provides texts, presents each member, and attaches links to tell us more about the history and experiences of the members to which the proposal presents. Overall, the plan of the proposal is very good, the budget is transparent and the members are all skilled and experienced, which increases the feasibility of the proposal. Proposal is highly feasible.
f6_assessments.q2: The author gives indicators to measure project progress according to feasibility. Detailed work schedule, members have enough skills and experience to complete the project on schedule. The budget is analyzed in detail, transparent and easily audited. Monthly progress reports to Catalyst. We are provided with the necessary information, making it easy for us to audit. And in the end result, here the listed short, medium and long term success indicators have been established. create. The team believes in the project, I think, in a positive way. Goals are broken down by time, by month, allowing the community to track whether what was intended has been achieved. Overall, we know the goals to be achieved and the value to the Cardano community and ecosystem.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you for the great feedback and positive review, we appreciate your work. We are excited about the future and looking forward to make a real world positive impact for students.
